items.title: Amla
items.summary: Amla is a quaint little village that seems to be stuck in a time warp. Life here carries on as it must have for centuries, with the odd exception of an electrical flour mill.

items.title: Bandhavgarh
items.summary: The Bandhavgarh National Park is one of the best places in India to spot a tiger and is also home to a wide range of other game such as nilgai, jungle cat, wild boar, hyenas and many species of birdlife.

items.title: Kanha
items.summary: Kanha National Park is considered to be one of the best places in the world to see tigers.
